cases.title: Knee Injury – Meniscal Tear
cases.presenting_complaint: Severe right knee pain post-tackle during a match
cases.subjective_evaluation: Reports sharp medial knee pain, locking sensations, and difficulty bearing weight. No prior injuries.
cases.assessment_data: MRI confirms complex tear of the medial meniscus (posterior horn)

rehabilitation_phases.acute_phase: Cryotherapy, non-weight bearing with crutches, isometric quadriceps activation
rehabilitation_phases.subacute_phase: Range of motion (ROM) exercises, closed kinetic chain strengthening, proprioceptive retraining
rehabilitation_phases.return_to_play_phase: Sport-specific drills, neuromuscular re-education, agility training

cases.biomechanics: Faulty landing mechanics; emphasis on valgus knee control

cases.title: Shoulder Dislocation – Anterior
cases.presenting_complaint: Right shoulder deformity and numbness after a fall while climbing
cases.subjective_evaluation: Intense pain, tingling down arm, history of 2 prior dislocations

findings: Severe ROM limitation in abduction and external rotation
Weak deltoid and supraspinatus (suspected axillary nerve involvement)

cases.assessment_data: X-ray confirms anterior dislocation, Hill-Sachs lesion

rehabilitation_phases.immobilization_phase: Sling support, pendular exercises, isometric scapular stabilizers
rehabilitation_phases.mobilization_phase: Controlled ROM, rotator cuff strengthening, proprioceptive training
rehabilitation_phases.reintegration_phase: Plyometrics, kinetic chain integration, return to climbing simulations

cases.biomechanics: Hyperlaxity of GH joint; needs scapulohumeral rhythm correction

cases.title: Ankle Sprain – Grade II Lateral Ligament
cases.presenting_complaint: Lateral ankle pain and instability post-marathon
cases.onset: Insidious during final miles, worsened after rest
cases.subjective_evaluation: Pain with ambulation, perceived instability, audible 'pop' during run

findings: Edema and ecchymosis over lateral malleolus
Positive anterior drawer and talar tilt test

cases.assessment_data: Radiographs show no fracture; clinical diagnosis – Grade II inversion sprain

rehabilitation_phases.phase_II: Resistance band strengthening, balance board work
rehabilitation_phases.phase_III: Dynamic stabilization, hop test training, proprioceptive ladder drills

cases.biomechanics: Overpronation and poor ankle dorsiflexion ROM; requires gait re-training

cases.title: Chronic Lower Back Pain – Disc Degeneration
cases.presenting_complaint: Dull low back ache with stiffness, worsening over months
cases.onset: Gradual onset, worse with prolonged sitting
cases.subjective_evaluation: Stiffness in mornings, increased discomfort with flexion and standing after sitting
cases.assessment_data: MRI shows L4-L5 disc dehydration and mild bulge

rehabilitation_phases.phase_I: Education on posture, McKenzie extension protocol
rehabilitation_phases.phase_III: Functional movement re-education, ergonomic assessment, lifting mechanics

cases.biomechanics: Anterior pelvic tilt, poor load transfer across lumbopelvic complex

cases.title: Wrist Fracture – Distal Radius
cases.presenting_complaint: Pain and visible deformity in right wrist
cases.subjective_evaluation: Crying, inability to move hand or hold objects
cases.assessment_data: X-ray confirms distal radius metaphyseal fracture

rehabilitation_phases.functional_phase: Fine motor retraining for age-appropriate activities

cases.biomechanics: Focus on developmental ergonomics and return to play

cases.title: Lateral Epicondylitis – Tennis Elbow
cases.presenting_complaint: Gradual onset elbow pain on lateral side
cases.subjective_evaluation: Pain with gripping, resisted wrist extension, and carrying groceries

rehabilitation_phases.phase_I: Load management, ice massage, isometrics in pain-free range
rehabilitation_phases.phase_II: Eccentric wrist extension loading, stretching ECRB

cases.biomechanics: Poor force dissipation in upper limb chain; focus on scapular strength
